intro: Krigia petiolaris, commonly known as the showy krigia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10 to 30 centimeters, featuring basal leaves that are elongated and often hairy. Its bright yellow flowers bloom in early spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Krigia petiolaris is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
